Text:
These are lossless flac file ripped from the original vinyl.
Complete artwork included.

Thanks you for this. I have been looking for these albums for a long time. Though, I really disagree with your thoughts about these albums. The first Paris album has the Zep influence. The second (Big Towne 2061) is closer to what Bob's solo records would turn out to be. More like his Fleetwood Mac songs. Both albums were WAY before their time.

eieio12

Yes, I agree. The first was heavier than the 2nd.
My band used to perform Black Book and Beautiful Dreamer in the early 80s.
The write up is taken from All Music Guide.
Would you happen to have the live bootleg of Paris?
...a boot? Wow! That would be cool..
